Caesium (CS)

Description

Gustav Kirchhoff and Robert Bunsen founded caesium in 1860, although the original concept was discovered by Carl Plattner in 1846. Caesium is mostly known for its use in drilling fluids.

Atomic Diagram

Atomic Number

55

Atomic Mass

132.905

Melting point

28.5℃

Boiling Point

671℃

Group

1

Period

6
